text: Mayiladuthurai Dry Fish Market (also known as Karuvattu Santhai or Mayavaram Karuvattu Santhai) is a market in Mayiladuthurai, Mayiladuthurai district, Tamil Nadu, India. This is the first dry fish market to be launched in Tamil Nadu. It has been over a century since its inception. The embryo market is 20 kilometers away from the coast. It is a common place for all fishermen and a place where outdoor merchants can easily access. The market meets on Sundays on Sunday at Siddharkadu, near the Mayiladuthurai railway station. About five thousand people come to the market that day; Business is going on for about five lakh rupees. Although the market is Sunday, the business will start at two o'clock on Saturday night. Karuwadi merchants from Ramanathapuram, Pudukkottai, Thanjavur, Thiruvarur, Cuddalore and Nagapattinam districts are coming to business. More than ten districts including Coimbatore, Karur, Trichy, Thanjavur, Salem and Thiruvannamalai are gathering here for the purchase of the car. Big merchants leave at two o'clock at night and end the wholesale business at six o'clock in the morning. Thereafter the small merchants spread the shop at five o'clock in the morning, and then the retail business will be held until the evening. == References ==
title: Mayiladuthurai dry fish market
